abstracts.cdata!:
The audit concurs with both the
            Implementation Completion Report (ICR) and Evaluation
            Summary (ES) ratings of satisfactory project outcome, likely
            sustainability, and substantial institutional development
            impacts, as well as the satisfactory ratings for both
            performances by the Bank, and Borrower. Lessons suggest that
            for regionally-sponsored environmental initiatives,
            responsive to inter-governmental action plans, provide good
            opportunities for the Bank to exercise its comparative
            advantage in leveraging institutional reform through
            targeted lending, and, if linked with grant funding from
            bilateral development partners, it fosters a powerful, and
            influential lobby for reform. Moreover, significant benefits
            can be achieved through a careful project design that
            addresses infrastructure investments, environmental
            management activities, and capacity building in an
            integrated manner, where multiplier effects will be
            achieved, supportive of local institutions, and their human
            resources development. However, it is important to
            understand the interests, and institutional capabilities of
            local stakeholders, specifically for community based
            activities, and to factor in sufficient time, and resources
            to build a consensus for reform, and agreement on long-term objectives.
